newsitem.title: USA: SofTech's accountants question ability to continue.
newsitem.headline: SofTech's accountants question ability to continue.

text.p: SofTech Inc said on Friday that its accountants raised concerns about the company's ability to continue as a "going concern" due to a change in SofTech's reseller agreement for one of its core products.
Under a new agreement with its primary supplier, Parametric Technology Corp, SofTech will no longer have the right to market and distribute Pro/ENGINEER.
Pro/ENGINEER, which has been the core product responsible for the growth of the CAD Division over the past five years, will now be available only through PTC's direct sales force.
SofTech will now distribute a new product to be introduced by PTC in September that will sell for half the price of Pro/ENGINEER.
Due to concerns about this new product and SofTech's reduced resources following the proposed sale of its NSG unit, the company's accountants questioned its ability to continue.
SofTech plans to sell its NSG unit to Data Systems Network Corp in early September.
Immediately following the sale, SofTech's vice president, Mark Sweetland, will be elected chief executive of SofTech. Sweetland will replace Norman Rasmussen, who will retire, the company said.
Also at the closing of the sale, the company said its current independent directors will resign after electing at least a comparable number of outside directors to replace them.

SofTech also said its line of credit that permitted borrowings of up to $10 million has been reduced to $1.0 million until the NSG deal is completed and the bank can evaluate the creditworthiness of its continuing business.
SofTech also said it filed a complaint against several former NSG division employees, alleging violation of non-compete and confidentiality agreements, as well as breach of loyalty to the company.
The civil case, filed State of Michigan courts, is seeking to enforce the confidentiality agreements and monetary damages.
